etymology.description: 艸(艸) (cǎo, "grass") + 盍(盍) (hé, "cover") = a thatched cover -> cover
etymology.interpretation: The character 蓋(gài, "cover") uses 艸 ("grass") to indicate a cover made of thatch, while 盍 acts as the phonetic element originally representing the "cover" sense. Over time, as 盍 also came to mean "why not," 蓋 took on the primary role for various 'cover' meanings.
etymology.simplification: 盖(蓋) is a simplier form from mainland China that preserves the meaning of covering, matching the phonetic sound of the original character.

examples.chinese: 请把盖子盖好(請把蓋子蓋好)。
雨后天晴时(雨後天晴時)，云盖着山峰(雲蓋著山峰)。
examples.pinyin: Yǔ hòu tiān qíng shí, yún gài zhe shānfēng.
examples.english: After the rain, when the sky clears, clouds cover the mountains.

examples.chinese: 大树的巨大树盖遮住了一切(大樹的巨大樹蓋遮住了一切)。
examples.pinyin: Dà shù de jù dà shù gài zhē zhù le yī qiè.
examples.english: The enormous canopy of the tree covers everything.
